summary: This appears to be an internal email or note from July 24, 2019, discussing a psychologist's recent evaluation of Jeffrey Epstein following an incident at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. It suggests coordination regarding who should handle follow-up care.

persons.name: Psy.D. Chief Psychologist
persons.role: Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: The psychologist who evaluated Jeffrey Epstein the day before this correspondence (for a Suicide Risk Assessment - SRA) and is being considered for follow-up care.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was seen by the Chief Psychologist for a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) the day before this correspondence.

events.title: Internal Discussion on Epstein's Care
events.description: Internal correspondence discusses who should handle follow-up care for Jeffrey Epstein following an incident, suggesting the Chief Psychologist who saw him the previous day is most relevant.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Federal prison where Jeffrey Epstein was held and where the Chief Psychologist worked.

keyFacts: The document is dated July 24, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death.
It references that Epstein was seen for a Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) on July 23, 2019.
The correspondence involves internal discussion about assigning follow-up psychological care for Epstein following an incident.
The Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center is identified as having recently evaluated Epstein.
The tone suggests procedural coordination regarding inmate mental health monitoring.
